author: Akane Otani
title: Technology Shares Plunge Again Amid Growing Backlash
text:
Shares of the biggest names in the technology industry extended their three-week decline Monday, raising fears among investors that cracks could finally be appearing in what had been one of the most enduring trades of the past year.
All together, the so-called FAANG stocks—Facebook Inc., Amazon.com Inc., Apple Inc., Netflix Inc. and Google parent Alphabet Inc.—which powered major indexes to repeated highs last year, lost $78.7 billion in market value Monday, bringing their declines since the Nasdaq Composite’s March 12 peak... RELATED VIDEO The Key to Understanding Facebook's Current Crisis Facebook's current data crisis involving Cambridge Analytica has angered users and prompted government investigations. To understand what's happening now, you have to look back at Facebook's old policies from 2007 to 2014. WSJ's Shelby Holliday explains. Illustration: Laura Kammerman
